svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 15, 2024" date: "2024-06-15"
Eth News and Links
Electra upgrade scope not finalized yet, Devcon ticket dates and Curve liquidations
All core devs
* All core devs – consensus (ACDC) #135 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
pectra-devnet-1 : consensus layer client teams expect to be ready in 1-2 weeks and
agreed to append committee bits field to end of attestation EIP7594 PeerDAS : building
on top of Deneb upgrade for now rather than Electra, aim for peerdas-devnet-1 in 2
weeks Blob count increase : discussion on increase with/without PeerDAS or PeerDAS
without an increase, needs analysis on devnets and proposal to uncouple blob count
from execution layer SSZ: EIP7688 change to SSZ StableContainer: devnet planned before
next ACDC to help decide whether or not to include in Pectra Naming F-starname upgrade
discussion for upgrade after Electra
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : pectra-devnet-1 : consensus layer client teams
expect to be ready in 1-2 weeks and agreed to append committee bits field to end of
attestation EIP7594 PeerDAS : building on top of Deneb upgrade for now rather than
Electra, aim for peerdas-devnet-1 in 2 weeks Blob count increase : discussion on
increase with/without PeerDAS or PeerDAS without an increase, needs analysis on
devnets and proposal to uncouple blob count from execution layer SSZ: EIP7688 change
to SSZ StableContainer: devnet planned before next ACDC to help decide whether or not
to include in Pectra
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
* pectra-devnet-1 : consensus layer client teams expect to be ready in 1-2 weeks and
agreed to append committee bits field to end of attestation
* EIP7594 PeerDAS : building on top of Deneb upgrade for now rather than Electra, aim
for peerdas-devnet-1 in 2 weeks
EIP7594 PeerDAS : building on top of Deneb upgrade for now rather than Electra, aim
* Blob count increase : discussion on increase with/without PeerDAS or PeerDAS without
an increase, needs analysis on devnets and proposal to uncouple blob count from
execution layer
Blob count increase : discussion on increase with/without PeerDAS or PeerDAS without
* SSZ: EIP7688 change to SSZ StableContainer: devnet planned before next ACDC to help
decide whether or not to include in Pectra
SSZ: EIP7688 change to SSZ StableContainer: devnet planned before next ACDC to help
* Naming F-starname upgrade discussion for upgrade after Electra
Naming F-starname upgrade discussion for upgrade after Electra
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade, likely targeting Q1 2025
* Consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.3 : specs for pectra-devnet-1
Consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.3 : specs for pectra-devnet-1
* PeerDAS breakout #1 : client implementation progress, proposal to move max blobs to
config & uncouple blob count from execution layer, keep activation logic same for
devnet-1 and bandwidth concerns for home stakers
PeerDAS breakout #1 : client implementation progress, proposal to move max blobs to
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 28.75% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 28.75% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Toni Wahrstätter: MEV-Boost users are reorged less & can better handle 6 blob blocks
compared with non MEV-Boost users but they include less blobs as not incentivized
Toni Wahrstätter: MEV-Boost users are reorged less & can better handle 6 blob blocks
* Parithosh: proposal to use torrents for distributing pre-merge data (EIP4444 history
expiry)
Parithosh: proposal to use torrents for distributing pre-merge data (EIP4444 history
* Vitalik: inclusion list proposal using one-bit-per-attester
Vitalik: inclusion list proposal using one-bit-per-attester
* Potuz: preconfirmation designs compatibility with proposed ePBS
Potuz: preconfirmation designs compatibility with proposed ePBS
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v5.2.0 : adds in-memory tree-states , optimized epoch &
block processing and execution client version in graffiti
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v5.2.0 : adds in-memory tree-states , optimized epoch & block processing
and execution client version in graffiti
* Execution layer: Besu v24.6.0 : Java v21 now minimum version and historic trie log
data removed by default
Execution layer:
* Besu v24.6.0 : Java v21 now minimum version and historic trie log data removed by
default
For Stakers
* Reth + Prysm archive node on $189 NanoPC-T6 board using ~10w
Reth + Prysm archive node on $189 NanoPC-T6 board using ~10w
* Lighthouse attestation simulator : Prometheus metrics for use with Grafana to track
Beacon Node performance; suggests running in APAC impacts performance
Lighthouse attestation simulator : Prometheus metrics for use with Grafana to track
Layer 2
* OP Stack fault proofs live on OP mainnet, now a stage 1 L2 (limited training wheels)
OP Stack fault proofs live on OP mainnet, now a stage 1 L2 (limited training wheels)
* RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile deployment status on L2s
RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile deployment status on L2s
* ZKsync airdrop , GitHub users need to associate an address
ZKsync airdrop , GitHub users need to associate an address
* Based preconfs live on devnet
Based preconfs live on devnet
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): Meta EIP7723 : Network upgrade inclusion
stages
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* Meta EIP7723 : Network upgrade inclusion stages
* RIPs (rollup improvement proposals): RIP7724 (clone of EIP7667 for zk rollups):
Raise gas costs of hash functions
RIPs (rollup improvement proposals):
* RIP7724 (clone of EIP7667 for zk rollups): Raise gas costs of hash functions
* ERCs (application layer standards): ERC838 (resurrected): ABI specification for
REVERT reason string ERC7720 : Deferred token transfer (ERC20) ERC7721 : Lockable
extension for ERC1155 ERC7722 : Opaque token
ERCs (application layer standards):
* ERC838 (resurrected): ABI specification for REVERT reason string
ERC838 (resurrected): ABI specification for REVERT reason string
* ERC7720 : Deferred token transfer (ERC20)
ERC7720 : Deferred token transfer (ERC20)
* ERC7721 : Lockable extension for ERC1155
ERC7721 : Lockable extension for ERC1155
* ERC7722 : Opaque token
ERC7722 : Opaque token
Stuff for developers
* Foundry show-progress flag : live progress of fuzz & invariant tests
Foundry show-progress flag : live progress of fuzz & invariant tests
* Remix v0.50 : QuickDapp plugin to create basic front end for contracts
Remix v0.50 : QuickDapp plugin to create basic front end for contracts
* Quantifying code complexity : CK, Martin & Halstead metrics using Slither printers
Quantifying code complexity : CK, Martin & Halstead metrics using Slither printers
* Guide to create a simple Solidity linter using Slang (Nomic Foundation’s compiler
APIs)
Guide to create a simple Solidity linter using Slang (Nomic Foundation’s compiler
* RareSkills: ERC7201 namespaced storage layout explainer
RareSkills: ERC7201 namespaced storage layout explainer
* Scaffold-ETH-Svelte : Scaffold-ETH v2 port to Svelte
Scaffold-ETH-Svelte : Scaffold-ETH v2 port to Svelte
* EF JavaScript team roadmap
EF JavaScript team roadmap
* Data Always PBS snapshot (Python script): create MEV data snapshots
Data Always PBS snapshot (Python script): create MEV data snapshots
Security
* UwU (Aave v2 fork) $23M exploit via oracle manipulation A further $3.7M stolen after
unpausing protocol
UwU (Aave v2 fork) $23M exploit via oracle manipulation
* A further $3.7M stolen after unpausing protocol
* Loopring smart wallet exploit via compromised 2FA service for wallets with only the
Loopring guardian
Loopring smart wallet exploit via compromised 2FA service for wallets with only the
Ecosystem
* Devcon tickets & tracks : Ticket raffle/auction starts June 18, discount
applications open July 9 & general admission waves start July 16 Speaker applications
open July 9
Devcon tickets & tracks :
* Ticket raffle/auction starts June 18, discount applications open July 9 & general
admission waves start July 16
Ticket raffle/auction starts June 18, discount applications open July 9 & general
* Speaker applications open July 9
Speaker applications open July 9
* Clr.fund Southeast Asian Ethereum communities quadratic funding round
Clr.fund Southeast Asian Ethereum communities quadratic funding round
Job Listings
* ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
* Alchemy - Wallet Services: Engineering Manager and Full-Stack Engineer
Alchemy - Wallet Services: Engineering Manager and Full-Stack Engineer
* Gnosis is hiring: Discord Moderator and Senior Web3 Software Dev (Wallet)
Gnosis is hiring: Discord Moderator and Senior Web3 Software Dev (Wallet)
* IMC: Quant Developer for DeFi and MEV focused team
IMC: Quant Developer for DeFi and MEV focused team
* Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
* Nethermind: Preconfirmations Senior Engineer , Protocol Researcher , Site
Reliability Engineer , Research Engineer - Starknet & Senior Marketing Manager
Nethermind: Preconfirmations Senior Engineer , Protocol Researcher , Site Reliability
Engineer , Research Engineer - Starknet & Senior Marketing Manager
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 2.4 to 104.0 gwei, with 10.7 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.5 gwei 9.7k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 2.4 to 104.0 gwei, with 10.7 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.5 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.5 gwei
* 9.7k ETH net issuance this week
9.7k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $3,367 - $3,713, currently $3,480, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $3,367 - $3,713, currently $3,480, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Curve co-founder Michael Egorov liquidated , triggered by UwU exploit, causing ~$10M
of bad debt which he has already repaid
Curve co-founder Michael Egorov liquidated , triggered by UwU exploit, causing ~$10M
* 100x (perps) live on Blast, up to 20x leverage on ETH & BTC, with Blast gold for
orderbook liquidity [ Starbloom portfolio]
100x (perps) live on Blast, up to 20x leverage on ETH & BTC, with Blast gold for
* Uniswap Labs acquired Crypto: The Game (onchain Survivor)
Uniswap Labs acquired Crypto: The Game (onchain Survivor)
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC Chair Gensler “envision[s]” spot ETH ETFs S-1s to be approved over US summer but
dodges question of whether ETH is a commodity
SEC Chair Gensler “envision[s]” spot ETH ETFs S-1s to be approved over US summer but
* Alex Pertsev attempting to be released while he appeals
Alex Pertsev attempting to be released while he appeals
General
* Privacy and Scaling Explorations trusted setup ceremonies via a browser: Anon
Aadhaar v2 Semaphore V4 phase 2
* Anon Aadhaar v2
Anon Aadhaar v2
* Semaphore V4 phase 2
Semaphore V4 phase 2
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-june-15-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jun 21 – EF EIP4844 data challenge extended deadline
Jun 21 – EF EIP4844 data challenge extended deadline
* Jun 21-23 – ETHKyiv hackathon & conference
Jun 21-23 – ETHKyiv hackathon & conference
* Jul 7 – Devcon scholars program deadline
Jul 7 – Devcon scholars program deadline
* Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
* Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
* Jul 29-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 29-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 2-4 – Ethereum Argentina conference & hackathon
Aug 2-4 – Ethereum Argentina conference & hackathon
* Aug 7-9 – Science of Blockchain Conference (New York)
Aug 7-9 – Science of Blockchain Conference (New York)
* Aug 15-17 – Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
Aug 15-17 – Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Aug 23-26 – ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
Aug 23-26 – ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
* Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
* Sep 5-8 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Sep 5-8 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon

Sep 9-15 – ETHSafari (Kenya)
* Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
* Sep 13-14 – Ethereum México
Sep 13-14 – Ethereum México
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Sep 26-27 – ETHMilan conference
Sep 26-27 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 4-6 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 4-6 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 4-6 – ETHRome hackathon
Oct 4-6 – ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 17-19 – ETHSofia conference & hackathon
Oct 17-19 – ETHSofia conference & hackathon

Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon

Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
